Umyndig.Under18.Bobletekst: Because you are under the age of 18, one of your parents or a guardian must sign the application together with you. You therefore have to fill out the application in paper form and send this by mail.
Umyndig.Under18.Boblelenketekst: A paper application can be downloaded here.
FeilsideInfo.GenerellFeil.Ingress: Unfortunately, something went wrong. Please try again later. If there are still errors please contact support.
Velkommen.Ingress.Del1: You can get lump-sum grant if you are expecting a child and have not had income that entitles you to parental benefit for 6 of the last 10 months. You will then receive a lump sum instead of parental benefit, which comes once a month.
Velkommen.Ingress.Del2: It is primarily mothers who can apply for lump-sum grant, but fathers/co-mothers can receive one-off benefits in some cases, these are described
Velkommen.Ingress.Del3: You can apply for parental benefit instead of lump-sum grant if you have had an income, served in the military or received any of these benefits from NAV: employment verification allowance, unemployment benefit, sickness allowance, care or care allowance. Parental benefit is a taxable benefit, which means that it gives you earnings for a pension and can entitle you to other benefits such as sickness allowance and care allowance.
Velkommen.Bobletekst.Del1: Remember that if the child has not been born yet, you must attach confirmation of due date
Velkommen.Bobletekst.Del2: If you adopt a child, you must attach confirmation of adoption
Velkommen.Info.Header: Choose lump-sum grant or parental benefit?
Velkommen.Info.Del1: You can choose to apply for lump-sum grant even if you are entitled to parental benefit. Please note that once you have received your decision on the granting of a lump-sum grant, you cannot change this choice.
Velkommen.Info.Del2: Parental benefit is a taxable benefit, which means that it gives you earnings for a pension and can entitle you to other benefits such as sickness allowance and care allowance. Lump-sum grant is not a taxable benefit and you will not earn a pension or be entitled to other benefits such as sickness benefit or care allowance.
Velkommen.Info.Del3: You can apply for parental allowance instead of lump-sum grant if you have had an income, been in the military or received any of these benefits from nav: employment verification allowance, unemployment benefit, sickness allowance, care or care allowance.
Velkommen.Info.Del4: When you receive lump-sum grant and the father/partner applies for parental benefit, you must be active while the father/partner is at home with the child. Activity can be work in a 70% to 100% position, full-time education, education and work which together become full-time, illness which means that you cannot take care of the child, participate in the qualification program or participate full-time in the introduction program according to chapter 4 for newly arrived immigrants.
Velkommen.Info.Del5: You can read more about activity requirements
Velkommen.Info.Veiviser.Link: Use the wizard to see what you may be entitled to
Velkommen.Samtykke: I confirm that I have read and understood
Velkommen.Validering.BekreftLestOgForstå: You must confirm that you have read and understood
Velkommen.KunEnStønad: If you choose to apply for the lump-sum grant, you cannot change your mind at a later date. You cannot receive both the lump-sum grant and parental benefits for the same child.

The date of the confirmation of the expected date of delivery cannot be in the future.
The confirmation of the expected date of delivery must show that you are in the 22nd week of pregnancy or later
TerminDokPanel.Vedlegg.Terminbekreftelse: Please upload confirmation of due date

You can get the appointment confirmation from your midwife or doctor. It must be dated in the 22nd week of pregnancy or later. If the child was born abroad and is not registered in the national register, you must attach the child's birth certificate.

personopplysninger.ingress.1: NAV collects and receives data pertaining to you when you submit an application. This is necessary for you to be able to receive the correct service and benefits.
personopplysninger.ingress.2: You have chosen to apply for the lump-sum grant. This is a National Insurance benefit that you may be entitled to if you satisfy the requirements. The requirements are listed at nav.no/engangsstønad.
personopplysninger.opplysningerViInnhent: your connection to Norway, your work situation and your income
social security schemes you may be entitled to in other countries
We can also send information about you to social security schemes in other countries.
personopplysninger.sectionheading: NAV processes your personal data in the following manner
personopplysninger.text.automatiskLagrin: the information you provide in the application
information about your work situation from the Register of Employees and Employers
information about your income from the A-melding report
If you apply after the child has been born, we will process your application automatically if we have sufficient information. The automatic processing is based on
personopplysninger.text.lagringAvOpplysn: If you submit the application, information you have provided in the application will be stored in accordance with the Norwegian Public Archives Act.
If you cancel the application, the information you have registered in the application will be deleted.
personopplysninger.text.opplysningerViIn: Data we collect from you and public registries
To process your application, we collect information relating to
personopplysninger.text.personvernerkler: You can read more about how NAV processes personal data in the Norwegian Labour and Welfare Administration’s Privacy Statement at {link}
personopplysninger.text.svarPåSøknaden.2: how you can access the case processing documents and the rules that were applied
personopplysninger.text.svarPåSøknaden.3: how to appeal if you disagree with the decision

søknadSendt.info.innhold: We have received your application and you do not need to do anything more. We will contact you if we have questions or if we need more information from you.
søknadSendt.pengene.infoBox: If your application is approved, your parental allowance will either be paid by your employer or by NAV. Check that you have registered the correct account number with us.

terminbekreftelsen.sectionheading: Confirmation of the expected date of delivery
terminbekreftelsen.text.terminbekreftels: You must attach confirmation of the expected date of delivery with your application. This must be dated and signed by a doctor or midwife during your 22nd week of pregnancy or later.
utenlandsopphold.leggTilUtenlandsopphold: What country did you live in?
Which country should you live in?
utenlandsopphold.neste12Måneder.spørsmål: Where are you going to live for the next 12 months?
utenlandsopphold.neste12MånederInfotekst: You answer to live abroad in whole or in part only if you plan to stay permanently in a country other than Norway. Short trips abroad in connection with, for example, holidays are not included.
Read more about future stays abroad
Stay abroad in whole or in part
utenlandsopphold.siste12Måneder.spørsmål: Where have you lived in the last 12 months?
utenlandsopphold.siste12MånederInfotekst: You answer lived abroad in whole or in part only if you have resided in a country other than Norway. Short trips abroad in connection with, for example, holidays are not included.
Read more about previous stays abroad
Lived abroad in whole or in part

velkommen.erMann.boblelenketekst: The application for the father can be found here.
velkommen.erMann.bobletekst: You cannot submit an application for the mother. If you are the person who will receive the lump-sum grant, you have to fill out the application in paper form and send this by mail.

velkommen.innsendingFeilet.ingress: Unfortunately, something went wrong during submission of your application. Please try again later. If the errors continue to occur {lenke}.

velkommen.text.nySøknadAdvarsel: Your existing application will be deleted.

utenlandsopphold.neste12Måneder.isRequir: You must enter where you are going to live for the next 12 months
utenlandsopphold.stotteFraNav: Stays abroad and support from NAV
utenlandsopphold.info.del1: To be entitled to support from NAV, you must be a member of Norwegian National Insurance. People who live in Norway are usually members of the Norwegian National Insurance
utenlandsopphold.info.del2: Whether you keep your membership in the national insurance during your stay abroad depends on where you will be staying and how long you will be there.
utenlandsopphold.info.del3: When you will be abroad for more than 12 months, we consider you to be resident abroad according to the Norwegian National Insurance Act's rules. The same applies if you will be abroad for more than 6 months a year for 2 or more consecutive calendar years.
utenlandsopphold.info.del4: You are no longer a member of the National Insurance Scheme when you are considered resident abroad.
utenlandsopphold.info.del5: When you are on holiday abroad, you are considered a tourist and retain your membership in the national insurance, if you have no income from work during your stay and your stay does not last longer than 12 months. As long as you are a member of the National Insurance Scheme, you generally retain the benefit.
utenlandsopphold.info.del6: You can read more about stays abroad at
utenlandsopphold.infoOmFødselsattest: You have stated that you will be in {country} when you have your term {term date}. If you give birth abroad, you must send us a birth certificate so that we can register the child's date of birth. The reason you must submit a birth certificate is that we do not receive information about the birth automatically when you do not give birth in Norway.
utenlandsopphold.info: A stay abroad is considered a holiday if you have no income from work during your stay and the stay does not last longer than 12 months. A holiday is not considered living abroad.
DokumentasjonSteg.Terminbekreftelse: When did you receive confirmation of the expected date of delivery?
